soc.client

Class TradePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • soc.client.ShadowedBox
              • soc.client.TradePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class TradePanel
extends ShadowedBox
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Panel for a trade offer or counter-offer in a non-client player's SOCHandPanel.

    Contains:

    • Text above the trading squares (1 or 2 lines)
    • A 2-row grid of trading squares, with labels to the left of each row such as "They Get", updated by setTradeOffer(SOCTradeOffer) or setTradeResources(SOCResourceSet, SOCResourceSet)
    • 3 buttons, appearing below the trading squares, or to their right if no room below ("compact mode")
    • Optional text below the trading squares, showing the Bot Offer Auto-Reject Countdown timer text, for offers made to client player if preference SOCPlayerInterface.getBotTradeRejectSec() is set and this panel isn't the counter-offer
    • Solid shadow along bottom and right edge, ShadowedBox.SHADOW_SIZE pixels wide

    The parent SOCHandPanel controls this panel's size, position, and visibility. TradePanel determines whether to use "compact mode" layout based on its height: If not tall enough to include the row of buttons, compact mode moves them to the right. See getCompactPreferredSize().

    When panel is used for showing trade offers to the client player, call setTradeOffer(SOCTradeOffer) to update fields and show/hide the Accept button.
    When used for counter-offers, call setTradeResources(SOCResourceSet, SOCResourceSet) instead. Its Send button is never hidden.

    The Bot Offer Auto-Reject timer assumes the "Reject" button is Button 2, and calls TradePanel.TPListener.button2Clicked() in the AWT Event Queue thread.

    Any reference to "unscaled pixels" means a dimension not yet multiplied by SOCPlayerInterface.displayScale.

    Before v2.0.00 the trade UI was TradeOfferPanel, which handled the offer and counter-offer and also included MessagePanel.

    Since:
    2.0.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • TradePanel

        public TradePanel(java.lang.String[] buttonTexts,
                  java.lang.String[] sqLabelTexts,
                  boolean isPlayerRow1,
                  boolean hasLine2,
                  SOCHandPanel hpan,
                  java.awt.Color tradeInteriorColor,
                  TradePanel.TPListener listener,
                  int displayScale)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Make a new TradePanel to hold a trade offer or counter-offer. The empty part of the panel will be tradeInteriorColor, not the background color. Uses parent hpan's current background color for the corners that aren't in shadow.

        After constructing both members of an offer + counter-offer pair of panels, call each one's setOfferCounterPartner(boolean, TradePanel) to designate roles.

        Parameters:
        buttonTexts - Array with 3 strings: Text for button 1, button 2, button 3
        sqLabelTexts - Array with 2 or 4 strings: Label for row 1 of the trading squares, for row 2, and those labels' optional tooltips
        isPlayerRow1 - True if player's own resources in the trade would be shown in row 1, false if row 2. For more info see canPlayerGiveTradeResources().
        hasLine2 - True if text above trading squares has a second line
        hpan - Parent handpanel, for game data callbacks and background color
        tradeInteriorColor - Color for the box interior (like SwingMainDisplay.DIALOG_BG_GOLDENROD), or null to use system defaults
        listener - Listener for callbacks when buttons pressed; not null
        displayScale - For high-DPI displays, what scaling factor to use? Unscaled is 1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if buttonTexts is null or length != 3, or hpan or listener or sqLabelTexts is null or its length is not 2 and also not 4. TODO: how can this not always be false?

    • Method Detail

      • setOfferCounterPartner

        public void setOfferCounterPartner(boolean thisIsCounterOffer,
                                   TradePanel otherMember)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set this panel's role and other member in an offer + counter-offer pair.
        Parameters:
        thisIsCounterOffer - True if this panel (not otherMember) is used for showing the counter-offer, not the offer
        otherMember - Other member of the pair of panels
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if otherMember is this panel itself or null

      • getTradeResources

        public SOCResourceSet[] getTradeResources()
        Get resource sets for each of the 2 resource square lines. Does not validate that total > 0 or that give/get totals are equal.
        Returns:
        Array with a resource set for line 1, and a set for line 2, from contents of this panel's resource squares
        See Also:
        setTradeResources(SOCResourceSet, SOCResourceSet), canPlayerGiveTradeResources()

      • setTradeResources

        public void setTradeResources(SOCResourceSet line1,
                              SOCResourceSet line2)
        Set trade panel's resource contents, or clear to 0.

        If panel is showing an offer (not counter-offer): To also set the "Offered To" text, call setTradeOffer(SOCTradeOffer) instead.

        If panel is showing a counter-offer, calls updateOfferButtons() to enable or disable the Send button based on player's current resources.

        Parameters:
        line1 - Trade resources to use in Line 1; will clear all to 0 if null
        line2 - Trade resources to use in Line 2; will clear all to 0 if null
        See Also:
        getTradeResources(), updateOfferButtons()

      • isOfferToPlayer

        public boolean isOfferToPlayer()
        Is the currently visible setTradeOffer(SOCTradeOffer) offered to the client player?
        Returns:
        True only if Component.isVisible() and current offer's "made to" players list includes the client player (designated earlier by calling setPlayer(SOCPlayer, int)).

      • setTradeOffer

        public void setTradeOffer(SOCTradeOffer offer)
        Set trade panel's "Offered To" text and resource contents, or clear to 0. Also shows button row, if previously hidden by calling setButtonRowVisible(boolean, boolean).

        If this is an offer to the player from a bot, and preference SOCPlayerInterface.getBotTradeRejectSec() is set, shows and starts the Bot Auto-Reject Countdown timer.

        Should be called when already showing an offer or about to do so. Not for use in a counter-offer panel.

        Parameters:
        offer - Trade offer details from hand panel's non-client player, or null to only clear resource squares to 0 and clear isOfferToPlayer() flag.
        See Also:
        setTradeResources(SOCResourceSet, SOCResourceSet), updateOfferButtons(), isOfferToPlayer()

      • updateOfferButtons

        public void updateOfferButtons()
        Re-check client player's current resources and based on panel's role, do one of:
        • Show the offer's Accept button if isOfferToPlayer(), hide it otherwise
        • Enable or disable the counter-offer Send button
        • If setPlayer(SOCPlayer, int) hasn't been called to set the client player and "resource button" number, do nothing
        Does not do anything to the auto-reject timer. If entire button row is hidden, does not show it.

      • canPlayerGiveTradeResources

        public boolean canPlayerGiveTradeResources()
        Does the player have enough resources to give what's shown in the panel? The player is null until set by calling setPlayer(SOCPlayer, int). Whether the player's resources are in row 1 or row 2 was designated by a constructor parameter.
        Returns:
        True if, given the resources currently in the panel for the player's half of the trade (player's row of the panel), they have those resources to give. False if setPlayer(SOCPlayer, int) hasn't been called to set a non-null player.

      • setPlayer

        public void setPlayer(SOCPlayer pl,
                      int playerResButtonNumber)
        Set or clear the optional player used by canPlayerGiveTradeResources() and setTradeOffer(SOCTradeOffer). Current convention sets to client player if any, or null.
        Parameters:
        pl - Player to use, or null to clear
        playerResButtonNumber - Optional button number (1-3) to enable only when pn has sufficient resources in their row of the resource panel, or 0.

      • setButtonRowVisible

        public void setButtonRowVisible(boolean shown,
                                boolean clearLineBelow)
        Show or hide the entire row of buttons. Also calls Container.invalidate(). When hidden and not in Compact Mode, the panel's getPreferredSize() is less tall.
        Parameters:
        shown - True to show, false to hide
        clearLineBelow - If true, also clear the text shown below the button bar, which will shorten the panel's height, and cancel the auto-reject timer if running.

      • setLine1Text

        public void setLine1Text(java.lang.String txt)
        Set text contents of line 1 that appears above the trading squares.
        Parameters:
        txt - Text to set, or null to use ""

      • getPreferredHeight

        public int getPreferredHeight(boolean ignoreButtonRow)
        Get our preferred height to use in Normal or Compact Mode. Same calc as getPreferredSize(), but without creating a Dimension or any other object.
        Parameters:
        ignoreButtonRow - If true, assume button row is hidden; useful for Compact Mode. If false, uses setButtonRowVisible(boolean, boolean) flag value.

      • getPreferredSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()
        Get our preferred size to use when not in Compact Mode. For size in Compact Mode see getCompactPreferredSize().
        Overrides:
        getPreferredSize in class ShadowedBox
        See Also:
        getPreferredHeight(boolean)

      • getCompactPreferredSize

        public int[] getCompactPreferredSize()
        Get our preferred size to use when in Compact Mode: Shorter but wider than normal mode.
        Returns:
        int array with [width, height] in compact mode
        See Also:
        getPreferredHeight(boolean)

        Custom layout for this OfferPanel, including the components within
        Overrides:
        doLayout in class java.awt.Container
